Package toystore

Class Store

java.lang.Object
toystore.Store
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A class that can only have one instance, implementing the singleton design pattern, with a private instance, and a static method to retrieve it. Methods implemented will alter the state of the store, changing prices of products, adding currencies and manufacturers.

The class also implements Serializable, since it is required to save the store state into a binary file. It is also require to serialize all the containing fields, and that is why Currency, Discount, Product implement Serializable.

See Also:
Serialized Form

    • getInstance

      public static Store getInstance()
      Static method to retrieve the instance of singleton Store
      Returns:
      Store instance

    • welcomeMessage

      public static void welcomeMessage()
      Used to display a welcoming message when entering our store

    • renewStore

      public void renewStore()
      If a csv is read once more, the Store is supposed to be overwritten, so the Collections of products and manufacturers must be emptied.

    • getCurrency

      public Currency getCurrency()
      Returns:
      current currency of the store

    • getProducts

      public java.util.List<Product> getProducts()
      Returns:
      the list of products from store

    • readCSV

      public java.util.List<Product> readCSV​(java.lang.String fileName) throws CurrencyNotFoundException
      Read the csv and save the result in a list of products. Uses the ParserCSV class to transform the csv file into a List of lists of strings and transforms it into a list of products.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of csv file
      Returns:
      list of products
      Throws:
      CurrencyNotFoundException - if the currency used in the csv file (GBP in our case) is not a valid currency (is not in the map of currencies)

    • transformStoreToCollection

      private java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> transformStoreToCollection()
      Before writing the csv we have to transform our data type (a list of products) to the data typ required by ParserCSV (a list of lists of strings)
      Returns:
      list of csv lines (which are also lists of strings)

    • saveCSV

      public void saveCSV​(java.lang.String filename)
      Save list of products into a csv file
      Parameters:
      filename - name of csv file

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct​(Product product) throws DuplicateProductException
      Add product to list only if the product is unique
      Parameters:
      product - product to be added in the list of products
      Throws:
      DuplicateProductException - if the product given is already in the list

    • getProductById

      public Product getProductById​(java.lang.String id)
      Retrieve product from the list, searching by it's id
      Parameters:
      id - id string of product
      Returns:
      Product with that id

    • addManufacturer

      private Manufacturer addManufacturer​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> strings)
      Add a new manufacturer to the collection, receives a line of csv file, a list of strings, form which it is retrieved only the manufacturer's name
      Parameters:
      strings - line of csv, list of strings
      Returns:
      a new manufacturer with that name, or the one with that name from the map

    • getManufacturerByName

      public Manufacturer getManufacturerByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Query the map and retrieve the object based on the given key
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the manufacturer, key to the Map
      Returns:
      Value in the Map

    • getListOfOrderedManufacturers

      public java.util.List<Manufacturer> getListOfOrderedManufacturers()
      Transform current collection of manufacturers (which is a Map) into a list of ordered Manufacturers
      Returns:
      A List containing values of the map

    • loadStore

      public static void loadStore​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Load store from a binary file, de-serialize singleton Store
      Parameters:
      filename - name of binary file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there are errors while reading the binary

    • saveStore

      public void saveStore​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Save the store to a binary file, serialize the singleton Store
      Parameters:
      filename - name of binary file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there are any errors while writing to the binary

    • createCurrency

      public void createCurrency​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String symbol, double parityToEur)
      Create a currency with those specified fields, and add it to the map
      Parameters:
      name - currency name
      symbol - currency symbol
      parityToEur - parity of currency relative to EURO

    • changeCurrency

      public void changeCurrency​(java.lang.String currencyName) throws CurrencyNotFoundException
      Takes a currency's name as parameter and checks whether it is a valid on or not. If it is, change the store's currency and all product's price according to the new
      Parameters:
      currencyName - currency name
      Throws:
      CurrencyNotFoundException - if the currency has not yet been created

    • createDiscount

      public void createDiscount​(DiscountType discountType, java.lang.String name, double value)

    • applyDiscount

      public void applyDiscount​(DiscountType type, java.lang.Double value) throws DiscountNotFoundException, NegativePriceException
      Apply a discount to the products, decrease the prices according to the discount type.
      Parameters:
      type - the discount type
      value - the discount value
      Throws:
      DiscountNotFoundException - if the discount has not been yet created and added to the map
      NegativePriceException - if the price resulted by applying the discount becomes negative, in this case do not apply the discount al all

    • getProductsByManufacturer

      public java.util.List<Product> getProductsByManufacturer​(Manufacturer manufacturer)
      Get all products that have the manufacturer given parameter
      Parameters:
      manufacturer - manufacturer object to search by
      Returns:
      list of products

    • calculateTotal

      public double calculateTotal​(java.util.List<Product> products) throws RequestTooManyProducts
      Calculate total price of products given parameter. We can give the same product multiple times, but if it's requested more times than it's actual quantity in the store, an exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      products - list of products to calculate the price for
      Returns:
      the price of the products cumulated
      Throws:
      RequestTooManyProducts - if there are requested more products than the actual quantity
